summary: This is an automated email notification from the Second Circuit Court of Appeals regarding the filing of a motion for bail/pretrial release by Ghislaine Maxwell's legal team in her criminal appeal. It includes a list of attorneys and court personnel notified.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The defendant in the criminal case United States v. Maxwell, whose legal team filed a motion for bail/pretrial release.

persons.name: Christian R. Everdell
persons.context: Listed as an attorney to receive electronic notice of the court filing.

persons.name: Bobbi C. Stemheim
persons.context: Listed as an attorney to receive electronic notice of the court filing.

persons.name: David Oscar Markus
persons.context: Listed as an attorney to receive electronic notice of the court filing.

persons.name: Tammy Tones
persons.context: A court deputy clerk listed to receive notice and for quality control purposes.

connections.description: Everdell is listed as an attorney receiving notice for the case, indicating he is part of Maxwell's legal defense team.
Stemheim is listed as an attorney receiving notice for the case, indicating she is part of Maxwell's legal defense team.
Markus is listed as an attorney receiving notice for the case, indicating he is part of Maxwell's legal defense team.

events.title: Bail Motion Filed in Maxwell Appeal
events.description: Ghislaine Maxwell's legal team files a motion for bail/pretrial release in the Second Circuit Court of Appeals.

events.title: Opposition to Bail Motion Due
events.description: The deadline for the government (United States) to file its opposition to Maxwell's bail motion is noted as April 12, 2021.

keyFacts: On April 1, 2021, Ghislaine Maxwell's defense team filed a motion for bail/pretrial release in the Second Circuit Court of Appeals (Case Numbers 21-770, 21-58).
The motion triggered a deadline of April 12, 2021, for the government to file its opposition.
The notification lists attorneys Christian R. Everdell, Bobbi C. Stemheim, and David Oscar Markus as part of Maxwell's legal team receiving notice.
The document is an automated court notification, indicating the procedural stage of Maxwell's appeal focused on her pretrial detention status.
